title: Ticket #7297: pytest-based tests succeed when schedd fails to start
description:
If the schedd fails to launch, then pytest-based tests will fail due to being unable to find the local schedd object. See: 

01/10/19 21:01:21 PersonalCondor environment started successfully!
01/10/19 21:01:21 Test 1: Attempting a valid HTTP transfer, expecting success
01/10/19 21:01:21 Submitting job with arguments: {'should_transfer_files': 'YES', 'output': 'cmd_curl_plugin-success.out', 'executable': '/home/cse496/bbockelm/projects/condor-build/src/condor_tests/cmd_curl_plugin_ctest/cmd_curl_plugin-success.py', 'transfer_input_files': 'http://127.0.0.1:29827/success', 'log': 'test-2999340.log'}
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "cmd_curl_plugin.run", line 210, in <module>
    main()
  File "cmd_curl_plugin.run", line 128, in main
    success_job.Submit()
  File "/home/cse496/bbockelm/projects/condor-build/src/condor_tests/cmd_curl_plugin_ctest/pytest/CondorCluster.py", line 51, in Submit
    self._schedd = htcondor.Schedd()
RuntimeError: Unable to locate local daemon
01/10/19 21:01:22 [PC: cmd_curl_plugin] Shutting down PersonalCondor with condor_off -master
01/10/19 21:01:22 Waiting for personal condor(s) to finish stopping...
01/10/19 21:01:27 [PC: cmd_curl_plugin] Master exited

Unfortunately, in the current test configuration, this results in the test case exiting with exit code 0 (i.e., succeeding!).
remarks:
2019-Oct-02 15:30:24 by tlmiller:
That sounds two problems:

  1. Why do we think (we shouldn't) that the personal condor environment started successfully if the schedd fails to launch?
  2. The test harness(es) need to either explicitly detect exceptions and fail the test as a result, or we need to switch from 'success unless' to 'failure unless' in harness(es).

[58012] may be of interest or relevance.
